title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to focus on execution and simplicity as the playoffs approach.
The Red Sox are currently 81-68, holding the second American League wildcard spot with 13 games left.
Boston has struggled recently, going 4-6 in their last 10 games, amid pressure to secure a playoff berth.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, saved by Luca Langoni's late equalizer.
Despite playoff hopes technically alive, coach Caleb Porter acknowledged the unlikely postseason path after Chicago's loss.
18-year-old midfielder Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, showing composure and potential in a central role.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora advises the Red Sox to focus on regular games, not playoffs, despite holding a wild-card spot.
The Red Sox, 1.5 games behind the Yankees, face roster challenges and a tougher schedule than the Rangers.
Playoff models give the Red Sox over a 90% chance of making the postseason, despite recent injuries and slumps.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow seeks a new general manager as a top priority this offseason.
The general manager role has been vacant since Breslow's appointment in 2024.
Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and Michael Groopman are among candidates for the position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round draft pick.
Polk struggled in his rookie season with 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns.
Patriots will also give up a 2028 seventh-round pick in the deal with the Saints.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots face their sixth consecutive loss in Miami against the Dolphins, having lost the last five games there.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel faces job security questions after a 33-8 loss to the Colts sparked a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots, boasting a 7-0 record since joining the Dolphins in 2020.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-themed concert at Boston's Roadrunner on September 12, 2025.
Cain's setlist included tracks like 'Willoughby’s Theme', 'Janie', and 'Waco, Texas', creating an immersive experience.
The concert featured a collaboration with Boy Harsher’s Jae Matthews on the song 'Vacillator', adding emotional depth.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior', portraying Mike Flynt, a 59-year-old college football player.
Chiklis returns to football for the first time since high school, depicting Flynt's true story of redemption.
The film will have a pre-release screening on September 14 in Boston, with a national release on September 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Massachusetts has nine residents on Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans, with net worths ranging from $3.9 billion to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson is the wealthiest Massachusetts resident, ranked 27th overall, with a net worth of $35 billion from Fidelity Investments.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft ranks as the 78th richest American, with a net worth of $13.8 billion, owning sports teams and businesses.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox scored only one run and recorded two hits in a 4-1 loss to Yankees at Fenway.
Starter Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings, but Boston's offense struggled significantly.
Boston's defensive errors contributed to the defeat, including three errors and a costly catcher's interference.
